alert.note: Alert for Uinta (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 08 at 2:56PM MST until February 08 at 3:30PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Central Uinta County in southwestern Wyoming... * Until 330 PM MST * At 254 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Evanston to 11 miles west of Robertson, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Impacted area will be along the Interstate 80 corridor from the Utah - Wyoming border eastward through Lyman. Locations impacted include... Evanston, Lyman, Mountain View, Ragen, Millburne, Fort Bridger, Almy, Piedmont and Leroy. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
